supply_logistics.supply_status: Strained but adequate for defensive operations. Primary constraints: fuel delivery from Tripoli (1100km), ammunition resupply limited by convoy losses to Malta-based aircraft and Royal Navy submarines. Water supply critical in desert environment.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain and rocky desert near Tobruk-Bardia sector

special_capabilities: Integration with German Afrika Korps units
known_issues: Insufficient anti-tank capabilities against British Matilda and Grant tanks
Low morale due to prolonged defensive operations and supply shortages
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Developed water discipline protocols, constructed defensive positions with overhead cover against air attack, adapted to night movement to avoid air interdiction

discovered_units.source: Nafziger 941gima.txt and 941gkaa.txt - Parent corps repeatedly mentioned as commanding Brescia, Pavia, Bologna divisions
discovered_units.reason: Parent formation mentioned in multiple Nafziger sources across multiple quarters in North Africa
discovered_units.combat_evidence: XXI Corps commanded Italian infantry divisions (Brescia, Pavia, Bologna) during Operation Compass defensive battles at Sidi Barrani (Dec 1940), Bardia (Jan 1941), Tobruk siege operations (1941), Battle of Gazala (May-June 1942), and First/Second El Alamein (July-Nov 1942). Commanded by Gen. Enea Navarrini in Nov 1941.
